ProfessionalSummary:
I LOVE THE CHALLENGE of researching, crafting and constructing UX product/designs, CX journeys and infor-
mation architecture flows for cloud products, search, analytics, metadata, mobile apps, and enterprise applications

MY SPECIALTY IS using my imagination, creativity, and divergent thinking skills in my UX toolbox along with
user research and testing to solve problems and devise intuitive user flows and visual designs for great companies
including IBM Cloud, AT&T Innovation Labs (the Foundry), AT&T U-verse TV, Texas Instruments, Mary Kay
Web Portfolio:    ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  

As an INNOVATOR and INVENTOR, I use my imagination and problem solving skills to:
•   Transform complex tasks for IBM Cloud to intuitive, easy to use designs from end-to-end service design research /
Innovate new UX design and information architecture from research recommendations including a GUI status update
box to track data transfers / Create new IA designs to combine several data migration services into one Cloud site /
Devise a "plug and play" solution with technical architect enabling a user to push a button to connect and move data
•   Reinvent UX designs for AT&T Innovation Lab collapsing several pages of forms to a 3-Clicks to Config solution /
Reimagine the buyflow, transforming form-heavy pages to an interactive Google Maps Meets Tinker Toys approach
•   Design workflows for data rich content innovating an advanced search box solution, Search/CLI, for IBM Cloud /
The UX solution helps users to find and organize their data and includes a dashboard-styled landing page enabling a
quick path to a desired task, a user-defined widget opening a saved configuration page and data visualization module


As a UX PRODUCT DESIGNER, RESEARCHER and INFORMATION ARCHITECT, I have a passion for:
•   Working with Product Owners to gather requirements, write use cases, flesh out new ideas and work flows including
strategizing IA approaches and UX designs to align with business goals and direction
•   Creating new complex animated workflows, data flows, user flows, sitemaps wireframes, for all digital touchpoints
and prototyping designs using various software programs including prototyping tools, Invision, Sketch, Zeplin, Bal-
samic, Adobe Suite, OmniGraffle, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript (familiarity with Axure)
•   Conducting complex UX research including end-to-end service design research, user testing, interviews surveys and
heuristic evaluations to understand customer needs, identify problem touchpoints and create user-centric designs
•   Tweaking Object-Oriented UX design process to assist in responsive design implementations
•   Designing with and contributing to UX components and visual designs for IBM's Carbon Design System patterns
•   Deliver designs to engineering team, steering development to match design specifications
•   Collaborating with a cross-disciplinary team to enrich the UX designs, back-end scalability and API interfaces
•   Following Agile methodology, participating in sprints and meeting defined critical milestones and deadlines

EducationDetails.Text:
University of Texas at Austin: B.A. in Journalism, Department of Photo Journalism, School of Communications
Brookhaven College: Visual Communications Department

SchoolName.Raw: Department of Photo Journalism, School of Communications
SchoolName.Normalized: Department of Photo Journalism School of Communications

EducationDetails.Text:
University of North Texas: Department of Learning Technologies: Studied with Regents Professor Dr. Gerald Knezek;
applied learning theories to formulate intuitive and data-driven understandings of how humans interface with machines and translating those complexities into simple user designs; co-authored paper for journal

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~~~~   is experienced in:  Information Technology; and User Experience (User Research).    ~~~~~~~~~   has 11 years of work experience.

JobTitle.Raw: Sr. UX Designer Mobile & Cloud Products
JobTitle.Normalized: Senior UX Designer Mobile AND Cloud Products

Positions.Description:
Designing data and user flows with wireframes for revenue tracking pipeline for Stronghold Resource Partners
•   Freelance contracting with Stronghold Resource Partners to build the IA and UX designs to enable an efficient and orga-
nized tracking of the data rich workflows and user task completion for an in-house app in Salesforce;
•   Creating rapid prototyping, low fidelity wireframes to gather data and move toward automated solution
GELPHMAN, - 2
Inventing a new customer service business model, PersonalConnect (patent pending) for the Mary Kay iShop Mobile app
• Innovated the PersonalConnect feature for the Mary Kay mobile app; the app serves as a personal communication
device and social network between a Mary Kay consultant and a group of clients
• Designed the web app to economically utilize the existing Mary Kay corporate website's backend structure
Creating imaginative IA and UX design for the Digital Data Habitat for Cloud developers
• With a technical architect, designing a new product that enables developers to create distributed, digital spaces that
are intrinsically buildable, searchable and deployable; a new Cloud distribution model called Core as a Service
• Product includes a method for creating metadata on the fly that then correlates and distributes information (metadata)
across a cloud app or through an IOT device and beyond, potentially feeding a Machine Learning or AI system

JobTitle.Normalized: User Experience Designer Researcher AND Architect

Positions.Description:
Designing delightful user experiences for a variety of cloud infrastructure storage offerings
• Worked with global team at IBM Cloud to redesign the catalogue/ordering/shopping cart workflows and navigation
for products and services; created custom web pages including plug-ins, forms and custom shopping cart style design
• Collaborated with Product Owners and Engineers to delivered mixed fidelity, InVision animated prototypes, user
flows, IA diagrams and responsive designs for Cloud offerings
• Presented designs and animated prototypes to leadership including VPs and Directors
• Innovated new UX designs and solutions from research for Cloud-based Object Storage and Data Migration services
including an advanced search box (Search/CLI) and a status update feature with "plug-&-play" data connections to move their data; combined all IBM Data Migration services into one cloud site
• Developed UX and visual design components for IBM Carbon Design System and pattern library
• Participated in Agile processes and sprints; implemented branding and produced style guidelines as needed

Conducting qualitative user testing and service design research on existing offerings and new designs
• Conducted heuristic evaluations, interviews surveys and usability studies with customers to validate existing sites
and new designs; wrote user stories for roadmap from results; conducted prototype testing and design revisions
• Completed comprehensive, end-to-end service design research of live, Data Transfer Service; identified points of failure, developed interactive, end-to-end flow diagram, mapped the customer's journey and created data visualiza-
tions from survey results; developed research report and evaluation of findings and presented to leadership

Forming an informal innovation team to implement a novel way to utilize metadata in a cloud environment
• Led an informal innovation team with technical architects to create a proof of concept for my novel way to correlate
and troubleshoot with metadata; led to metadata curation product, IBM Metaocean; feeds AI or Machine Learning
• Reviewed plans, drawings and concepts with direct report, IBM Softlayer CTO Marc Jones, who approved our work

Converting drop-downs and form fields into an interactive, visual buy-flow process for the iPad on Salesforce platform
• In an iPad enterprise application deployed in the Salesforce environment, created wireframes and visual designs for ATOM app, the Partner Exchange (PE) application with an Agile development process (InVision in portfolio)
• Designed the Welcome Tour, dashboard, and data mapping utility; redesigned the existing PE buy-flow for ATOM
• Created wireframes, visual design and style guidelines for Salesforce iPad application; includes a Quick Quotes link
from the Dashboard, a 3-Clicks to Config screen innovation
• Conceptualized and created low fidelity wireframes for conversion of the form-heavy buy-flow to an interactive and visual, one-screen process; users build a plan/map utilizing familiar icons and symbols much like an architect or
engineer; with functionality similar to Google Maps, the user can zoom out to view the plan with hundreds of sites

AT&T U-verse TV Training -- Lead User Experience & Visual Designer / Information Architect
Creating state of the art user experience and visual design for the U-verse TV technical training template (iPad mLearning)
• Created an intuitive user-interface design for tablets with responsive design for U-verse TV streaming media
• Incorporated elements of the iPad GUI to enable end-users to navigate seamlessly through the app
GELPHMAN, - 3

Developing a simulated, virtual machine interface with photography to teach complex mechanized processes on an iPad
• Created an interactive photographic interface for the SAI Crossbox for U-verse TV streaming media
• Utilized photography, color, and animation as metaphors to simulate machine and network processes
• Employed photographic animation interface as content for the learner, as interactive media to trigger engagement,
and as navigation and instrument of interaction

User experience inventions, innovations and honors for AT&T training projects
• Invented and developed the concept of "crowdsourcing" to update the performance support tool for U-verse Prem
Techs; Technicians in the field use the video and photographic functions of the iPad to create scenarios and training
• Selected by the executive director of training group to present visual and UI design of two projects at the quarterly
Designer Showcase; the Showcase is virtually attended by an AT&T VP and the entire Learning Services community


Texas Instrument's Education Division -- Contract Visual Designer / Interaction Designer
Creating visual designs and promotional materials for TI's education website
• Created visual design for company webpages, banner ads, promos, targeted emails, and videos; executed TI brand
• Worked with the marketing team, designed, illustrated and edited animated videos to introduce new features of TI
Nspired Navigator System and the Interactive Math Classroom (IMC); integrated voice-over narration into the video

Achievements: User experience inventions, innovations and honors for AT&T training projects
QualificationsSummary:
SKILLS & PROFICIENCIES
Applications: Sketch, InVision, Zeplin, Balsamiq, Illustrator, Photoshop Professional, Dreamweaver, Flash,
Omnigraffle, Visio, DrawIO. Acrobat X Pro, InDesign, Lectora, Key, limited Axure
Project Tracking Tools: Jira, Confluence, Git Hub, Aha
Scripting: HTML5, CSS3, XML, ActionScript 3, limited AngularJS and Bootstrap

Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'SKILLS & PROFICIENCIES'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS

Other Work Experience
Gelphman Camera Company, Inc. -- Product Inventor, Prototype Developer, User Experience Designer
Product and Software Invention and Development for the Topocam camera / User Centered Design
•	Invented and patented digital-imaging, robotic camera (Topocam) that makes motion and time visible
•	Developed two prototypes as a new educational technology; managed a team to develop and program the software
•	Distilled a complicated process, operating a robotic machine, into a simple and intuitive user interface
•	Used camera/software experimentally in math/science elementary, middle school, and high schools classrooms,
including two National Science Foundation (NSF) projects and Department of Education SBIR grant

Technology and Cognition - children learn advanced math and science concepts with the Topocam MicroWorld
•	Developed the camera's educational process as a "micro-world", a learning system where children use "objects-to-
think-with" to stimulate extraordinary thinking and as an incubator of knowledge (from personal communication
with Seymour Papert, Lego Chair for Learning Research, MIT Media Lab, author of Mindstorms)
PATENTS FOR THE TOPOLOGICAL PANORAMA CAMERA (TOPOCAM)
(U.S. Patent Number 4,943,821) Topological Panorama Camera
(U.S. Patent Number 5,920,735) Method and Apparatus to Observe the Geometry of Relative Motion
(U.S. Patent Number 6,536, 783) Method and Apparatus for Three Dimensional Modeling of an Object
